name: Antarctic Eyewear
description: -Gives the wearer a pair of goggles and a new hairdo- 3LODs-Hair is paintable. -Fits Scout, Sniper, Engineer, and Demoman-Concepted, modeled, textured, flexed and rigged by  QuestionablyInsane and his questionable brain-Sniper's sideburns were flexed by NeoDement-SFM still art was made by the Crazy skilled Deasdemona and photoshopped by QuestionablyInsaneI always loved the goggles on the forehead look so I wanted to make a cosmetic of that for TF2. I went with a generic aviator/ winter kind of goggles so you can mix it in for whatever look you are going for. Multiple unique hairdos just seemed like a cool idea and seemed like a fun challenge to try out. I have the goggles over the eyes of characters who have eyewear in game because I find it odd seeing multiple pairs of glasses/ goggles on a person. Also it adds some more variety which I like.

name: The Hot Case
description: - 3LODs-Team colored trenchcoat and scarf-Scarf is paintable. -Concepted, modeled, texturing and rigged by  QuestionablyInsane and his questionable brain-SFM still art was made by the Crazy skilled Dilly Dong and Deasdemona and photoshopped by QuestionablyInsaneThere’s a long story behind this jacket but I’ll give you an abridged version. This jacket is a total remake of an unreleased jacket I made 4 years ago.  That jacket, among other things, were part of a 1930s noir themed community update a few of my buddies and I were involved in… We were over our heads at the time and the update never came together but I always had fond memories of that project. The reason I never finished this Pyro set until now is it felt like I would be putting the final nail in the coffin of that misadventure long ago. Anyways this was a trip to work on. Nothing tells you that you have become a better artist better than to revisit your old work. In the case of this coat it was so bad that I just opted to start from scratch. Also I’ve become aware that this item resembles a certain female thief that no one can seem to find. :P

name: The Burning Question
description: - 2 LODs- Team colored fedora and lighter- Whole hat is paintable- Works with most gasmasks without clipping-Concepted, modeled, texturing and rigged by  QuestionablyInsane and his questionable brain-SFM still art was made by the Crazy skilled Dilly Dong and Deasdemona and photoshopped by QuestionablyInsaneThis hat has been a long time coming. I started this hat 4 years ago for a scrapped Noir themed community project. It has been collecting dust on my hard drive along with a few other cosmetics ever since. Unlike the trench coat of this set, which I totally remade from scratch, this hat I just reworked from my old model. The lighter however was totally remade from the old one. Fun bit of trivia for you guys: It’s common for 3D artists to recycle old models they have made in the past to make new items… Because why spend time remaking something you have already made in the past? Why I say this is “The Classy Capper” I made for the Sniper recycled bits of this old hat’s model. So time for you to meet Papa Classy Capper with a face lift.

name: The Scotch Guardian
description: With four times more barrels, you can shove four times more deadly explosives up your enemies' respective bottoms!This is my first real model ever. It is a grenade launcher designed with the special ability to shoot all four barrels at once in mind.The launcher has 3 LODs, the grenades have 2.I know Valve comes up with their own attributes for weapons, but here's how I'd imagine it:Hold Primary to build up chargeReleasing Primary fires one extra grenade for each second of charge (up to 3)Charging decreases accuracy-30% walk speed when charging-25% damage doneIt would be extremely efficient for crowd control, but firing all 4 grenades at once would require a bit of timing, and the spread would prevent you from getting instant kills too easily.

name: Unusual Effect: Static Mist
description: This is part of [particle-mayhem.tf2maps.net]What if we took electric eels in a water tank, shrunk them down to a micro-sized scale, and put that into an air-based mist? Well, we tried doing that, and found out that it caused way too many heart attacks. Since some tried to sue, we replaced the eels with static electricity, and here we are. No lawsuits.

description: It's a known fact that ghosts are indeed scary, however, our mercs are trained not to fear the undead. Infact this little guy follows you around, much like your creepy ex-girlfriend. All on Halloween of course... if it isn't October then no ghost is going to be around when you're out of toilet paper... you're on your own with that one I'm afraid... -- *All Class *Paintable *LoDs *Self Illumination *Jiggle bonesModel/Textures: VapJigglebones/Rigging: Toxicweasel

name: The Tiny Texan V2
description: “His brain may be the size of a pea. But he’s still smarter than you.  “3 LODsPaintable (Glowing eyes, Cab, and Engineer’s shirt)Jiggle bone HatchesSmoke particle effectsGlowing eyesFacial Flexed (Little guy moves around for certain facial animations)I did the remodeling, texturing, facial flexes, and some of the promotional workFlat Penguin  did the Jiggle-boning, and the smoke particle effectsDilly did the amazing SFM pictures. Special thanks to RetroMike,  JPRAS, Jukebox, and E-Arkham  for helping me out with technical issues.ARTIST NOTES: Remaking this item was a really fun experience.  I made the Tiny Texan last year but it didn’t get picked and I thought the concept was cool enough to take a shot at it again. (I was also getting a few messages from fans of the old Tiny Texan asking me to resubmit the item this year.  That was really touching guys.) It was exciting to have a second shot at trying to achieving the vision I had with this item now that I have become a better artist.What’s extra cool is two of the biggest fans of my old Tiny Texan actually helped me on the remake of this new Item! Dilly loved the item so much back then that he wanted to make a promotional SFM picture for free. He’s been my  main SFM  guy since. And Flat Penguin, another talented workshoper, added me as a friend after seeing the old Tiny Texan and we have been good friend and working companions ever since as well. ^_^Get the item in mod form here: [mods.tf]Also check out some of these awesome Halloween items made by my friends:

name: The Soviet Show-off
description: Tired of all those capitalist bullies mocking your puny muscles? Bulk up to mutant mass and show those pigs your true might with a delightful, yet frightening display of fitness, form, and physique!~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~UPDATE 7/1/15Thank you all very much who have voted and supported me and the taunt. I hope you all enjoy it! I worked hard on it, and I'm very glad to see it in game!~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Enjoy the video trailer! There is a 3-point video showcase of the taunt (rendered without motion blur for clarity) at the end of the video.I've started work on this taunt way back before Expiration Date when the taunt workshop was just hinted at, it was nearly 70% done but I stopped for a long time until the time limit on taunts has been raised up to 10 seconds. I brushed it off and turned it into a finished product.This was not intended to be used as a taunt kill or anything like that ("explosions not included"). That is entirely up to Valve to decide upon.Facial animation is limited as I wasn't sure if it would conflict with the way lipsync works in game. I can go back and add some more detail in the face if I need to.All taunt animation, images (title card, preview image, posters, backpack icon) entirely done by me.Notes to Valve: This taunt is exported at 30 frames per second.I had an issue when previewing the taunt in TF2 where the Heavy's weapon wouldn't hide though I had "hide weapon" ticked when exporting. I emailed both SFMSupport and the TF Team before uploading but never recieved a response. I am more than willing to assist someone at Valve with fixing any issue if they're interested in the taunt.Very special thanks to Nonames for animation critique and Vap for helping me upload the backpack icon!

name: Rifleman's Regalia V2
description: -Team colored-3 Lods-Paintable shoulder boards, pockets, and sleeves.-Bullets and darts fit in chest pocket-Compatible with pouch cosmetics-Concepting, Modeling and Texturing  was done by Questionablyinsane-The tough job of rigging was done by Duke-SFM Still art was made by the talented Dilly and Daesdemona and photoshopped by Questionablyinsane-The Video was made by the incredibly gifted animator Hypo and scripted, narrated, edited and effects done by Questionablyinsane-Rebbacus for creating the shirtless sniper in one of the images-Maxxy for helping me with creating the custom Miss Pauling in the promo art and making the Demoman used in the art as well. -Dilly for helping me get custom props I made into SFM to use for the promo art. -Jukebox for use of his Barefoot builder cosmetic  for one of the images.-And JPRAS for answering the many questions that cropped up  when making this set.This jacket was made originally just to be a single cosmetic to compliment the Sola Topi. Well halfway through making it and after some discussions more items started to be thought up and concepted… And things escalated quickly until this was a full blown huge set… This jacket is loosely based off a jacket I loved in the movie “ The Mummy” but is also a blend of many old uniforms I liked.

name: The Most Dangerous Mane V2
description: -Paintable Beard-Facial Flexes-Built to blend seamlessly with “The Gentlemann”-Concepted, modeled and textured by Questionablyinsane-Facial flexes done by the famous NeoDement. -SFM Still art was made by the talented Dilly and Daesdemona and photoshopped by Questionablyinsane-The Video was made by the incredibly gifted animator Hypo and scripted, narrated, edited and effects done by Questionablyinsane-Maxxy for helping me with creating the custom Miss Pauling in the promo art and making the Demoman used in the art as well. -Dilly for helping me get custom props I made into SFM to use for the promo art. -Jukebox for use of his Barefoot builder cosmetic  for one of the images.-Rebbacus for creating the shirtless sniper in one of the images-And JPRAS for answering the many questions that cropped up  when making this set.The story how this beard came to be is weird and hard to tell. Short story is that I really wanted a friendly mutton chop for the sniper but my friend JPRAS already made one. So I was trying to combine this beard with the hats and have them all work as styles so I wasn’t stepping on his toes… But after many discussions, my friends persuaded me that all the hats and the beard deserved to be separate items. Now that I had a beard misc. being made I really wanted it to be unique from my friends item…  So I just slapped a manly prosthetic butt chin on him and called it a day. Friendship intact.

name: The Scholar V2
description: -Team Colored Helmet and felt lining-Paintable hatband-Jiggle boned straps.-[UPDATE] Now all-class-Concepted, modeled and textured by Questionablyinsane-Jiggleboning was done by my good friend Flat Penguin.-SFM Still art was made by the talented Dilly and Daesdemona and photoshopped by Questionablyinsane-The Video was made by the incredibly gifted animator Hypo and scripted, narrated, edited and effects done by Questionablyinsane-CDJO, Digivee, Retro Mike, and Farexes, Duke, NeoDement are contributed for helping on other things in the set.-Maxxy for helping me with creating the custom Miss Pauling in the promo art and making the Demoman used in the art as well. -Dilly for helping me get custom props I made into SFM to use for the promo art. -Jukebox for use of his Barefoot builder cosmetic  for one of the images.-Rebbacus for creating the shirtless sniper in one of the images-And JPRAS for answering the many questions that cropped up  when making this set.Funny story: Part of the reason this set has 3 hats is that we couldn’t agree with on what hat should be made to go with this set. So we went and made them all. Originally I didn’t want to make a Pith helmet as I felt the Sola Topi filled that slot nicely. Actually this whole set started with me just wanting a cool Jacket to go with the Sola Topi. After this Pith helmet was made though I wound up liking this Pith helmet better. I may be biased as the creator but yeah. I guess my friend knew what he was talking about… Also Again Flat Penguin did a great job on the jiggle bones and it’s fun seeing the straps sway around

name: The Hunter V2
description: -Team Colored-2 LODs-Paintable feather-Jiggle Boned Feather-Concepted, modeled and textured by Questionablyinsane-Jiggleboning was done by my good friend Flat Penguin.-SFM Still art was made by the talented Dilly and Daesdemona and photoshopped by Questionablyinsane-The Video was made by the incredibly gifted animator Hypo and scripted, narrated, edited and effects done by   Questionablyinsane-Maxxy for helping me with creating the custom Miss Pauling in the promo art and making the Demoman used in the art as well. -Dilly for helping me get custom props I made into SFM to use for the promo art. -Jukebox for use of his Barefoot builder cosmetic  for one of the images.-Rebbacus for creating the shirtless sniper in one of the images-And JPRAS for answering the many questions that cropped up  when making this set.Dunno about you guys but I always loved badass hats with history and so that was what I tried to capture in this hat. Originally this hat was just going to be the default sniper hat with a bunch of stuff strapped to it similar to the trophy belt. Due to technical issues with the rim around the brim of his hat, I had to make the entire hat from scratch. Also this was going to originally have the beard attached to it…. Long story.  But in the end this just turned out to be a cool hat and the way how my friend got the feather to sway on this is just icing on the cake.

name: The Tundra Top
description: - 2LODs-Team colored hat and patch-Fits all classes-Every hat has a unique class patch-Whole hat is paintable. -Concepted, modeled, rigged by Mark Unread (the barbarian)-multi-classing, texturing and promos by  the still questionably insane QuestionablyInsane -SFM still art was made by the wonderful  and talented DaesdemonaOkay this one is a bit of a story… I made friends with this guy a while ago called Mark Unread who I knew for being more of an SFM animator. (He worked on the really cool Ghostbusters Saxxy Animation) Anyways One day we were chatting and he showed me this beanie he was working on for the medic.  He said he was looking for a texture artist. I vonluteered and started in on the project. He said he was wanted the beanie to fit the Heavy as well… Well originally the beanie had this large cross rather than a patch for the medic and he had just a plain beanie for the Heavy… Well due to different time zones he went to bed an left me to my work… And as I was working… I thought : Wouldn’t the Heavy’s beanie look good with his class emblem as a patch? So I made that… And things were just going so fast and then I thought… It’s a bit odd to have it for only 2 classes… I wonder how it’d look on all the classes?... And for some reason this project just flowed and I was able to make the hat for 6 of the classes all with their own class emblem patch that night. I showed Mark Unread in the morning what I did kinda worried that he’s be a bit upset me doing a ton of stuff without consulting him.. But coolly enough he was ecstatic! So yeah… That’s how a small project become a big project but it was a ton of fun and Mark Unread was super cool to work with.

description: - 3LODs-Team colored Lenses and Filter-Rubber mask area is paintable. -Concepted, modeled, texturing and rigged by  QuestionablyInsane and his questionable brain-SFM still art was made by the Crazy skilled Dilly Dong and photoshopped by QuestionablyInsaneOkay this one has actually been in my head for over 2 years! Due to just life and other projects I never got around to it. Actually I’m very surprised the workshop waited for me to put it out … There’s this very real thing I just call “The Workshop juju” (patent pending) where if you have a good idea then no matter what, there is going to be some guy you have never met or talked to across the world who is thinking up the same darn thing! Anyways yeah I hope I hit the mark with a cute cartoony animal themed gas mask… And not some creepy, latex fetish, furry thing. Sometimes a mentally disturbed guy wearing a cute reindeer gasmask is just a mentally disturbed guy wearing a cute reindeer mask! …. Oh and for you sharp eyed guys who really tune into details… The Gas mask filter says: XMAX - 16QI…

name: Sky High Fly Guy
description: -Replaces the Soldier’s army helmet with an old school ww1 style leather pilot helmet.-Team colored helmet and goggles-Helmet is paintable-3 LODs-Concepted, modeled, and textured by Questionablyinsane-SFM promotional art was made by the talented Dilly and Daesdemona and photoshopped by Questionablyinsane-Maxxy for helping me with creating the custom Miss Pauling in the promo art.-Dilly for helping me get custom props I made into SFM to use for the promo art. -Bapaul for his awesome airplane model used in one of the pics. I can’t be the only one that finds old dorky hats oddly charming. I’ve got kinda a lore going with my Grand Gentlemenn series of sets. Story is that all these sets are based on 1920s explorers just after World War 1. So after making a few sets the idea came that I’d need to have a pilot in the group to get the crew to their exploration sites. So with that in mind I started to look up a ton of WW1 pilot images and scheme up a set. I’ve always been a fan of leather aviator helmets but this helmet was something else. This helmet seemed like it was the model made before the leather pilot hat got to be traditionally cool looking. Really what comes to mind is the helmet looks like an old leather football helmet with goggles strapped on. It’s dorky and I love it! But yeah another bit of trivia: The goggles were actually  modeled LONG before I ever got around to making this cosmetic. I made this pretty cool set for the Demoman with had a Tank helmet and goggles that I never released… So repurposed those goggles for this helmet because I liked them so much. You can’t steal from yourself.
